intro: Plagiobothrys canescens var. apertus, commonly known as the open-flowered plainscore, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its flowers are usually pale blue to purple in color and bloom in the spring. It is an herbaceous perennial that produces capsule fruits containing small, wind-dispersed seeds.
